t: Isaiah 43
The Redeemer of Israel
But*pn now, thus says the Lord,*s who created you, O Jacob, And*ld He who formed you, O Israel: “Fear*ld not, for I have redeemed you; I*ld have called you*i by your name; You*ld are*i Mine.

When*ld you pass through the waters, I will*i be*i with you; And*ld through the rivers, they shall not overflow you. When*ld you walk through the fire, you shall not be burned, Nor*ld shall the flame scorch you.
For*ld I am*i the Lord*s your God, The*ld Holy One of Israel, your Savior; I*ld gave Egypt for your ransom, Ethiopia*ld and Seba in your place.
Since*ld you were precious in My sight, You*ld have been honored, And*ld I have loved you; Therefore*ld I will give men for you, And*ld people for your life.
Fear*ld not, for I am*i with you; I*ld will bring your descendants from the east, And*ld gather you from the west;
I*ld will say to the north, ‘Give them up!’ And*ld to the south, ‘Do not keep them back!’ Bring*ld My sons from afar, And*ld My daughters from the ends of the earth—
Everyone*ld who is called by My name, Whom*ld I have created for My glory; I*ld have formed him, yes, I have made him.”
Bring*ln out the blind people who have eyes, And*ld the deaf who have ears.

Let*ld all the nations be gathered together, And*ld let the people be assembled. Who*ld among them can declare this, And*ld show us former things? Let*ld them bring out their witnesses, that they may be justified; Or*ld let them hear and say, “It*i is*i truth.”

“You*ld are*i My witnesses,” says the Lord,*s “And*ld My servant whom I have chosen, That*ld you may know and believe Me, And*ld understand that I am*i He. Before*ld Me there was no God formed, Nor*ld shall there be after Me.
I,*ld even*i I, am*i the Lord,*s And*ld besides Me there*i is*i no savior.
I*ld have declared and saved, I*ld have proclaimed, And*ld there*i was*i no foreign god*i among you; Therefore*ld you are*i My witnesses,” Says*ld the Lord,*s “that I am*i God.
Indeed*ld before the day was,*i I am*i He; And*ld there*i is*i no one who can deliver out of My hand; I*ld work, and who will reverse it?”
Thus*ln says the Lord,*s your Redeemer, The*ld Holy One of Israel: “For*ld your sake I will send to Babylon, And*ld bring them all down as fugitives— The*ld Chaldeans, who rejoice in their ships.
I*ld am*i the Lord,*s your Holy One, The*ld Creator of Israel, your King.”
Thus*ln says the Lord,*s who makes a way in the sea And*ld a path through the mighty waters,
Who*ld brings forth the chariot and horse, The*ld army and the power (They*ld shall lie down together, they shall not rise; They*ld are extinguished, they are quenched like a wick):
“Do*ld not remember the former things, Nor*ld consider the things of old.
Behold,*ld I will do a new thing, Now*ld it shall spring forth; Shall*ld you not know it? I*ld will even make a road in the wilderness And*ild rivers in the desert.
The*ld beast of the field will honor Me, The*ld jackals and the ostriches, Because*ld I give waters in the wilderness And*ild rivers in the desert, To*ld give drink to My people, My chosen.
This*ld people I have formed for Myself; They*ld shall declare My praise.
Pleading with Unfaithful Israel
“But*pn you have not called upon Me, O Jacob; And*ld you have been weary of Me, O Israel.

You*ld have not brought Me the sheep for your burnt offerings, Nor*ld have you honored Me with your sacrifices. I*ld have not caused you to serve with grain offerings, Nor*ld wearied you with incense.
You*ld have bought Me no sweet cane with money, Nor*ld have you satisfied Me with the fat of your sacrifices; But*ld you have burdened Me with your sins, You*ld have wearied Me with your iniquities.
“I,*ln even*i I, am*i He who blots out your transgressions for My own sake; And*ld I will not remember your sins.
Put*ld Me in remembrance; Let*ld us contend together; State*ld your case,*i that you may be acquitted.
Your*ld first father sinned, And*ld your mediators have transgressed against Me.
Therefore*ld I will profane the princes of the sanctuary; I*ld will give Jacob to the curse, And*ld Israel to reproaches.
